item.title: 【UPSCALED】Alan Walker & Ava Max - Alone, Pt. II (Live at Château de Fontainebleau) [4K AI Upscale HEVC 10-bit / PCM 24-bit]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic, Pop
Style: Dance-pop, Electro House, Techno
Year: 2019
Video Source: Vimeo Web Master 1080p
Audio Source: Qobuz Hi-Res 24-bit

"Alone, Pt. II" is a song by British-Norwegian record producer and DJ Alan Walker and American singer Ava Max, released by Sony Music on 27 December 2019. It is a sequel to Walker's single "Alone" (2016). Many remixes of the song were published, among which those by Rave Republic, Toby Romeo, RetroVision, Da Tweekaz, and one by Alex Skrindo, in collaboration with Sebastian Wibe. Much like the original, "Alone, Pt. II" also garnered critical acclaim. Jason Lipshutz of Billboard praised the song, stating that it "demonstrates the evolution of Walker’s production techniques". He also described Max's vocals as "a moment designed for glass-clinking, unified swaying and other forms of party camaraderie".

The official music video of the song was uploaded on Walker's YouTube channel on 27 December 2019. The Kristian Berg directed video was filmed in the Vietnamese province of Quảng Bình between 2 and 10 April 2019, in locations such as the Sơn Đoòng cave, Tróoc river, Chay river, Tra Ang bridge, Doong village, En cave and Nuoc Nut cave. A second video, also directed by Kristian Berg, was released on 17 February 2020, and was filmed live at the Château de Fontainebleau castle in France (the music video of this release).

Release Info
The video track is upscaled to 4K with Topaz Video AI and encoded to HEVC 10-bit.
The PCM track is lossless (Qobuz, HiRes 24-bit), synced with Adobe Audition.
The timed lyrics are synced and edited to match the music video.
Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.

item.title: 【Helpdesk】[TUTORIAL] How to decode 360RA into 7.1.4 WAV (LC@L3 only)
item.description:
Hi eveyone ! Since theres now a lot of 360RA rips available on the forum, I think it's a good idea to show you how to decode them into wav files since the player I've posted does not work with the LC@L3 rips.

Here's the requirements :
  • libmpegh : https://github.com/ittiam-systems/libmpegh/releases/tag/latest
  • The missing System32/SysWOW64 .dll files: https://github.com/vicboma1/loaderDumpsArcade-solved-problem-vcruntime100
1. Download the ia_mpeghd_testbench.exe file from the release link
2. In order to set the decoder as a native Windows command, put it into your PATH Variables, here's a detailled tutorial to do it : https://www.computerhope.com/issues/ch000549.htm (It's not necessary but it's more convenient)
3. If you don't have the Visual Studio .dll files in your System32/SysWOW64 folders, it may happens that the program will show you some errors and then completely stop, here's a homemade quick tutorial :


Now that these steps are completed, you can now run the decoder proprely.
The basic command for decoding to the original speaker setup configuration is:
(MAKE SURE THE REPLACE THE FILENAME !)
Code:
ia_mpeghd_testbench -ifile:input.m4a -ofile:output.wav
But you can also indicate to the decoder to downmix/upmix to a specific speaker setup it with:
Code:
ia_mpeghd_testbench -ifile:input.m4a -ofile:output.wav -cicp:NUMBER
Here's the list of numbers and it's specific speaker setup:
Code:
1: - C
2: - L, R
3: - C, L, R
4: - C, L, R, Cs
5: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs
6: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs, LFE
7: - C, Lc, Rc, L, R, Ls, Rs, LFE
8: NA
9: - L, R, Cs
10: - L, R, Ls, Rs
11: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs, Cs, LFE
12: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs, Lsr, Rsr, LFE
13: - C, Lc, Rc, L, R, Lss, Rss, Lsr, Rsr, Cs, LFE, LFE2, Cv, Lv, Rv, Lvss, Rvss, Ts, Lvr, Rvr, Cvr, Cb, Lb, Rb
14: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs, LFE, Lv, Rv
15: - C, L, R, Lss, Rss, Ls, Rs, Lv, Rv, Cvr, LFE, LFE2
16: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs, LFE, Lv, Rv, Lvs, Rvs
17: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs, LFE, Lv, Rv, Cv, Lvs, Rvs, Ts
18: - C, L, R, Ls, Rs, Lbs, Rbs, LFE, Lv, Rv, Cv, Lvs, Rvs, Ts
19: - C, L, R, Lss, Rss, Lsr, Rsr, LFE, Lv, Rv, Lvr, Rvr
20: - C, Leos, Reos, L, R, Lss, Rss, Lsr, Rsr, LFE, Lv, Rv, Lvs, Rvs
BONUS CMD COMMAND FOR DECODING A WHOLE FOLDER :
Code:
for %f in (./*.m4a); do ia_mpeghd_testbench -ifile:"%f" -ofile:"%~dpnf.wav"
item.author: SonMaxime

item.title: 【UPSCALED】Alan Walker & Ava Max - Alone Pt. II [4K AI Upscale HEVC 10-bit / PCM 24-bit]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic, Pop
Style: Dance-pop, Electro House, Techno
Year: 2019
Video Source: Vimeo Web Master 1080p
Audio Source: Qobuz Hi-Res 24-bit

"Alone, Pt. II" is a song by British-Norwegian record producer and DJ Alan Walker and American singer Ava Max, released by Sony Music on 27 December 2019. It is a sequel to Walker's single "Alone" (2016). Many remixes of the song were published, among which those by Rave Republic, Toby Romeo, RetroVision, Da Tweekaz, and one by Alex Skrindo, in collaboration with Sebastian Wibe. Much like the original, "Alone, Pt. II" also garnered critical acclaim. Jason Lipshutz of Billboard praised the song, stating that it "demonstrates the evolution of Walker’s production techniques". He also described Max's vocals as "a moment designed for glass-clinking, unified swaying and other forms of party camaraderie".

The official music video of the song was uploaded on Walker's YouTube channel on 27 December 2019. The Kristian Berg directed video was filmed in the Vietnamese province of Quảng Bình between 2 and 10 April 2019, in locations such as the Sơn Đoòng cave, Tróoc river, Chay river, Tra Ang bridge, Doong village, En cave and Nuoc Nut cave. A second video, also directed by Kristian Berg, was released on 17 February 2020, and was filmed live at the Château de Fontainebleau castle in France. As of May 2023, the video has amassed over 317 million views and 5 million likes.

Release Info
The video track is upscaled to 4K with Topaz Video AI and encoded to HEVC 10-bit.
The PCM track is lossless (Qobuz, HiRes 24-bit), synced with Adobe Audition.
The timed lyrics are synced and edited to match the music video.
Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.

item.title: 【Requests】[REQ AUD] - Peter Fox, Charlotte De Witte, Mia Julia [QUBOZ] (2x Album, 1x Single)

Hi,
